name: Workshop // Learn to Spin Yarn : 2day mid-week Katoomba
description:
NEW Mid-week Beginner sessions now booking for Tuesday 19 + 26 November! This is the FINAL Learn To Spin Workshop for 2013. 

Handspinning yarn is experiencing a revival.. It's high time you join in the fun! Join me to learn to spin our own handspun yarn using a Spindle and/or a Spinning Wheel set in my Katoomba studio, in the picturesque Blue Mountains Australia. 

All the essential basics are covered & you'll be spinning yarn by the end of this course. A brief rundown of my program:
- learn about various fibers available to hand-spinners, including animal, plant, man made & the value of using natural fibres.
- how to choose fleece for making specific projects
- fibre preparation methods & uses
- so.. exactly what is woollen & worsted? I'll explain the mystery of these two spinning & fibre prep methods
- navigate your way around a spinning wheel
- spin a singles yarn using short-draw
- ply your singles
+ handspun yarn finishing methods: the conundrum to 'set the twist' or 'to NOT set the twist' will be revealed! There will be a lot of laughs & fun thrown in for good measure

NOTE: The Drop Spindle module is the first session in this 2day workshop, and may be taken separately as a 1day course. Use the drop down menu to select the Drop Spindle 1day Option.

*For best results, you will require a wheel to spin/practice on at home. Please drop me a comment if you need help in procuring a good 2nd-hand or new student wheel.

Like to book a private workshop? 
Contact me to request dates, then once confirmed, use this listing to book online.

Price included tea and snacks, BYO Lunch. A small selection of fibre is provided for use in class.

My Spin Sessions have been attended by a many people fascinated by this ancient art form to learn the art of hand-spinning in a friendly, professional atmosphere. I love to share my passion for spinning unique threads! You can find our more in the About Me menu below.

name: Bespoke // Unknit Loop necklace // "This Is Not a Chain Store" series
description:
Expressive One of a Kind woolly-wears
________________________________

Yes, "This is Not a Chain Store" : Unknit Loop // is the latest Signature neckwear design from Wooldancer

Lovingly made with pure wool, peace silk and seacell, handfull's of luxury natural fibres from our studio

Unknit Loop // warms your verb during Autumn, Winter and Spring

Wear long or short, looping over your neck for comfort and style

Each Unknit Loop is a work of craftswomanship : 
lovingly handmade with our own handspun yarn, right off the bobbin of our ancient spinning wheels

-> Listing is for one Unknit Loop similar yet different, as each is unique, to the item pictured // MADE & CUSTOMIZED especially for YOU! Choose colour from the above menu

>>Need to Customize your piece?
Place colour preferences, comments, allergy information in Comments at Checkout. Thank you.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Be One of a Kind.. wear a woolly-wonderful original by Wooldancer
xo

name: NEW Leather jewelry & accessory collection IN STORE SOON!
description:
Featuring a divine range of remnant offcut & new leather, I have designed this Hand Spun textile collection inspired by my recent trip to the wild Sierras of California. Each piece is One of A Kind and unique 
Leather rings $12-15
Neckwear, various styles $30-65

name: Art Wear Jewellery // Talisman necklace // Celtic Knot
description:
I am thrilled to offer you a unique statement piece that reflects your love for art and craft..

This listing is for the Bespoke necklace pictured in 1st pic.
NOTE: Bespoke orders will not be taken until Sept.

Talisman jewellery pieces are interactive >> bend and shape it for maximum comfort and individual style! I like to bend small circles, or simply let it drape freely to find its own sculptural form.

Luxury handdyed Super Soft merino wool and silks, handspun around a jewellery wire 

Deluxe pendant version available with gemstone, lava stone, ceramic or glass beads securely attached.

name: Art Beanie // Galactic Diver // Will fit Adult & Child
description:
One of a Kind, Not for the feint-hearted.. this extraordinarily unique beanie is waiting for the perfect person to play with!

Modeled by my daughter, this beanie also fits me well.

I handspun a very bulky yarn using hand-painted merino, wool, silk fabric remnants and lots of sparkle .. you can see this yarn featured in the attached lariat. Combined with a delicious magenta hand-painted wool yarn, this beanie is snug and pretty too!

May be worn in two ways, as pictured.

This delightfully whimsical beanie is sure to impress!

name: Neckwear // Unknit Loop // "This Is Not a Chain Store"#2

Unknit Loop // warms your verb during Autumn, Winter and Spring

Wear long or short, looping over your neck for comfort and style

lovingly handmade with our own handspun yarn and original 'Ready To Wear' yarn designs

name: OOAK Handspun Art Yarn update Coming Soon!
description:
I am thrilled to present my newest bootie of hand spun yarn..

My handspun yarn is spun as one-of-a-kind or in Limited Editions. Many of my yarns will never be repeated, works of art that are guaranteed to bring oy to every Textile Lover!

New & improvised art yarn techniques feature in these two ecclectic collections, inspired by earthly and etheric realms.. a textural feast I hope will inspire new horizons for your creative crochet, weave and knitting projects..

Prices from $38.00

..
stay tuned for the update
xo
Michelle

name: USA // Spin-to-Wear Tour 2day workshops // sold out
description: I'm thrilled to present 'Beyond The Skein: Spin To Wear 2day Workshops in USA, hosted by two amazing hosts: - SWAY Guild & Picasso's Moon, Sarasota Florida 3/4 Aug + - Madison Wool & Wildwood Farm, Madison CT 10/11 Aug ***NEW ONE DAY OPTION FOR MAD WOOL ONLY*** Click the link to book for SARASOTA FL workshop: BOOK NOW SARASOTA FL Read more & Book Below for MADWOOL workshop: Held in the picturesque farm studio at Wildwood Farm in Madison CT on August 10/11, 10am-5pm. Hosted by Madison Wool. A 2day Master class in Art Yarn spinning & creation with a focus on composing and designing ready-to-wear handspun accessories right on the spinning wheel! Michelle will share her secrets to creating 3 Unknit neckwear designs, including: - Spinning Multi-Plied chain constructions to design a Loop:do:Loop scarflette - Twist On Twists technique as seen in Lexi Boeger's book 'Hand Spun', using Rolags which we will card in class - How to spin over wire using a few different techniques to create your own Talisman necklace. Other New techniques covered: Twists in Singles 2ways, Butterfly-cocoons, Carding clouds on a board carder & Lofty lap batts. This workshop is jam-packed with fun art yarn improvisations. It is essential you know how to spin a singles and wheel spin, this class is suited to experienced beginners, intermediate & advanced spinners. Prepare to spin outside the box and create timeless One of a Kind wearable Art yarns! Limited seats available, BOOK NOW to secure your place! A materials list will be emailed to you upon enrollment.

name: YARNIVAL CA USA // Spin-to-Wear Tour // BOOK NOW
description:
The 2013 Wooldancer BEYOND THE SKEIN, SPIN TO WEAR workshop Tour is now open for bookings!
YARNIVAL CA 19-21 JULY
+ PICASSO'S MOON FL 3/4 AUG 
+ MADISON WOOL CT 10/11 AUG 
--------------------------------------------
Inspire your spin repertoire and master tricks to creating Ready-To-Wear designer neckwear right on your spinning wheel! Be prepared to spin outside the square & discover essential design elements that will add POP to your handspun yarns! Most importantly, you will take home your own handspun wearable art.

I am excited to offer 3 mini-workshops during Yarnival, [see below for descriptions] & thrilled to present a master-class of these sessions during the 2day workshops on the East coast. 

SAT 20 Jul Session 1: TWIST ON TWISTS.. as seen in Lexi's book 'Hand Spun' - Mega twists in Singles & plied yarns / create Rolags on a drum carder / + make an UNKNIT scarf. 9am-12:30pm

SAT 20 Jul Session 2: HIGHLY-WIRED - Corespin on wire in 2ways create batts without using carders / + working with wire to make a Talisman necklace. 1:30pm-5pm

SUN 21 Jul Session 3: MULTI-PLY - take a simple NPly chain to dizzying heights, interchanging singles & corespinning in one yarn / Learn essentials of yarn design / + make a LoopDeLoop Scarflette! 9am-12:30pm

You must know how to spin a Singles yarn on a spinning wheel. Plus I have Extra fun for Advanced Spinners up my sleeve!
Materials Required will be emailed to participants.
 
YARNIVAL is Your opportunity to take a class with me for only $60 per session, or take all three classes for $150!

Use Drop-down Menu below to Book Your Workshop now!

name: Handspun Art Yarn // WARPed! // Vege Patch dreaming
description:
Another delicious, one-of-a-kind colourway to infuse your senses!

Dreaming of the colours of a summer vegetable garden!

This delicious chunky Corespun yarn is made from fine Merino and delicious handdyed textures, carefully wrapped with fine thread for contrast. 

Our 'Warped Energy' Handspun yarn series features thick energized singles yarns with fresh twist energy, & a black thread giving a warp-like look to the surface texture.  Looks amazing woven, knit, crochet or simply placed in a decorative vase!

Specs for Vegie Patch:
Australian Merino, curly Australian Finn fleece, textured silk, angelina mylar & metal, cotton and border leicester locks by Neauveau Fibre Arts

30m 
5WPI
recommended size 8+mm hook or needles

// Wooldancer : Pure joy for your handspun creations

name: BESPOKE Neckwear // Nesting // unisex neck cozy
description:
Crafted with a delicate woven stitch formed with a Tunisian Shepherd's hook, merging knitting with crochet to produce a timeless textile accessory you will reach for every season

Choose from the available colourways in the menu above

Each piece is artisan crafted from our natural-dyed and naturally-coloured handspun wool yarn

Adorn yourself with living colour and natural fibres, lovingly created in our Wooldancer Fibre Art Studio
xo

name: Neckwear // Spring Tulip Scarflette // Merino & soy/milk fibre
description:
Wooldancer original design, the Tulip Spring Scarflette is the epiphany of neck adornments for Spring and in-between seasons..

Handspun with Milk &/or Soy fibre, the newest fashion-trend in eco-fibres. Milk is regenerated from milk protein during whey production.. Soy is manufactured from tofu waste. 

These alternative silken fibres are Perfect for people with wool-sensitivities..

Pure merino wool has been handdyed in a delightful Spring palette

How To wear:
Short } fold in half and loop tails through fold, or wrap and tie half-knot
Long {pictured} wear as for Short, or wrap around neck two or three times for added warmth.

Please mention in Comments if you have preference for Milk or Soy, otherwise we shall select what is in stock.

name: Drop Spindle // High Whorl // Jaffa 48gr / 1.7oz
description:
Spin your very own handspun yarn with our new one-of-a-kind exquisitely hand-turned drop spindles. We offer a selection of High & Low whorl spindles for spinning fine to bulky weight yarn.

- Jaffa specs:
Weight: 48gr / 1.7oz
Whorl: Camphor Laurel
Shaft: Red Cedar
Finish: watercolour with wax finish

Local wood-turner Jan Pennell finely crafts each spindle with care, adding a creative signature to each piece with the use of patterning and coloration. Together we are proud to bring you a timeless artisan hand-spinning tool to take everywhere you go!

If you see a spindle you like, don't hesitate!

Introductory offer: Spinning Top Special - take 10% off when you add one handdyed wool top to your spindle purchase with coupon code: TOPSPIN10. Offer ends midnight March19 2013.

description:
Spin your very own handspun yarn with our new one-of-a-kind exquisitely hand-turned drop spindles. We offer a selection of High & Low whorl spindles for spinning fine to bulky weight yarn.

- Mambo Low Jumbo specs:

Whorl: Jarrah

Finish: natural wax finish

Local wood-turner Jan Pennell finely crafts each spindle with care, adding a creative signature to each piece with the use of patterning and coloration. Together we are proud to bring you a timeless artisan hand-spinning tool to take everywhere you go!

If you see a spindle you like, don't hesitate!

Introductory offer: Spinning Top Special - take 10% off when you add one handdyed wool top to your spindle purchase with coupon code: TOPSPIN10. Offer ends midnight March19 2013

name: Gift Card { i heart you } photo cards
description:
I am thrilled to make available my original Gift Card series, featuring my works and sweet slogans. 

Each card features an original printed photograph, without watermarks, blank inside.

Series includes:
 - I Heart You (available in horizontal and vertical formats)
Other cards available, pic coming soon!
- A sweet Bouquet
- Congrats on Tieing the Knot
not pictured:
- Warm Fuzzies
- Various Yarn images without slogan for every occasion!

name: BESPOKE Batt Bundles // featuring EL locks + Spingredients
description:
Fibre-Art bundles, a stunning assortment of handdyed premium fibres, paired with minimally-carded Art-batts for maximum texture play, a coordinating wool top + Spingredients.. The ultimate Art Yarn adventure!

The Premium fibre:
English Leicester locks in one of kind handdyed and coordinated lots.. shiny & lustrous with a soft hand, these high-quality locks are perfect for felting and tailspinning projects

Batt Assortment:
A Handdyed & semi-carded selection of luxury fibres to compliment and show off those amazing locks!
Batt may include Finn, EL, Merino, Alpaca, Seacell, Silks, sparkles, threads.

Spingredients:
A hand-selected array of quality add-in's to enhance the theme. Each bundle will contain silghtly different elements, chosen at random to coordinate beautifully. 
May include silk cocoons; felt shapes; shells; wooden, glass, metal beads, fabric strips. Elements are suitable for spinning into yarn, embellishing knitwear, or as a focal piece if felting or spinning yarn for jewellery.

Note:
This is a custom listing. All photos are examples only. Your bundle will be handmade especially for you!

name: BESPOKE Rolags // Fibre Art set // Treasure Mix
description:
// Bespoke  - Mystery pot-luck listing // Made To Order.

Created from our Signature textured Art Batts, FARolags are a tightly hand-rolled bundle of texture that are great for spinning Quick Coils and fun singles yarns.

Note, My Rolags are not smooth and thin preparations, be prepared for a wild & fun spin!

My usual wild mix of handdyed local fleece, a little combed top, garnished with an array of noils & a wee sprinkle of sparkle to top them off!

75gr/2.65oz

To spin, simply pull from the tip end. Our FARolags are a woollen preparation designed for spinning with a pseudo worsted inchworm technique.

// See how I card and spin Rolags in my new video on the Tutorials page in the menu bar below.

Photos are examples of what your Treasure Rolags may look like! This is a mystery rolag listing, carded to order.

name: Private Workshop Booking request
description:
Would you like to visit me in my Studio for a Private Spin, Dye or Carding session?
I have held many 1 & 2day weekend sessions with people interested in learning how to spin, & with folks who wish to further their skills in various fibre arts, or even to receive mentoring.

My studio is located in Katoomba, in the picturesque World-heritage-listed Blue Mountains, 1.5hours drive west of Sydney.

What you do next:
- Fill in the Contact me form with date required
- You will receive reply form me within 24hrs to confirm date 
Use this listing to leave a deposit for your booking. 
Note: Prices vary depending on the subject and duration of your visit.

I look forward to spinning out with you!
Michelle

name: Textile Art // Handspun // Rainforest Dreaming
description:
One of a Kind textile art

Rainforest Dreaming was inspired by bushwalks I take down into the forest floor of the National Park where I live. Often I sketch my ideas with my camera, then work in my fibre studio to create the finished piece expressed as yarn.

As a yarn, this piece could be woven into a thin scarf,
worn an Infinity scarf (looped once or twice around the neck), 
however, I feel this piece is comfortable as an artwork on your wall. You decide!

Specs:
Alpaca, seacell, raw silk yarn fingerknit and incorporated whilst spinning, Wensleydale locks from Namaste Farms, Silk Opener sheets from Oscar & Sophia, Falkland wool top, felted leaves.

One of a Kind Textile Yarn Art from my hands to yours xo

name: Plant-dyed Pouch // handdyed felt with handspun strap
description:
Keep your essentials cosy and stylish. Dyed with leaf matter, the neutral earthly colours will coordinate beautifully with your wardrobe

Plant Pouches are one of a kind handdyed Wool felt, coaxed with pleasing natural colours of the plants used in the dyepot, and finished with a unique adjustable handspun strap. 

Each rustic handspun strap beautifully coordinates with the colour and texture of the felt, creating a one of a kind, Artisan Pouch that is both comfortable and functional! Each pouch is unique.

Plant pouches Available in two sizes, shown in PIC 2:
- medium } fits a coin purse, phone & keys 
- small } fits smart phone and lipgloss

Guaranteed one of a kind, handmade with heart xo

name: Bespoke Handspun { choose your style } I'll spin yarn for you!
description:
I offer my unique handspinning as a bespoke service for your beautiful knit, felt and textile art projects

I spin a variety of unique styles inspired by traditional and artyarn techniques to highlight texture, colour composition and yarn weight. Each yarn is One-Of-A-Kind, especially crafted for you! 

You are welcome to choose a Wool Batt from the Bespoke Batt listing, and I can spin it for you in one of these styles:

BEEHIVE-BEHAVIOUR
 Bulky 2ply with Coil features made from combed & carded/raw fibres. Perfect for knit beanies, scarves or bags as an edge or feature focal yarn

CANDY-SWIRL
 Bulky 2ply pure merino wool. Suits Chunky and Big knit projects.. oversized cowl perhaps?

CLOUDMALLOWS
 Energized Thick & Thin fine merino, feels as soft as cloud marshmallows! A fun staple yarn to knit, crochet or felt into a quick scarf. Cast on 10sts/10mm needles & knit your heart out!

SQUIGGLE-PLY
 Fresh fleece, handwashed and minimally prepared to exaggerate the natural form of the curls and crimp in the fibre, plied with a cotton/linen thread for squiggle texture. A special yarn for nature-lovers
 
BESPOKE
 Need a special yarn for your special project? Purchase the BESPOKE option & leave colour/fibre preference details in Comments at checkout. 
We'll consult via email to discuss your needs, then I'll turn your vision into yarn! 

NOTES
- Need additional yarndage/length? 
Purchase multiple quantities at checkout

name: Batts // Bliss Collection // Knittydoll 60gr
description:
Handdyed & blended wool batts gently hand-carded for maximum texture.

This Finn is the finest I have ever come across. Hailing from the southern hills and grown by a shepherdess who is a textile artist, you will find no finer a Finnish Landrace flock.

- Batt Contains:
Finn, Merino, Silk throwsters, Angelina

Perfect for craft projects, hand-spinning, felting, needle felting.

name: BESPOKE BATTS // Batt Lab // various styles
description: We are thrilled to now offer our BATT LAB online! Enhance your creative handspun yarn! Our batts are made with handdyed fibre, then handcranked into truly lovely blends of fibres.. with the Wooldancer trademark for ingenuity & quality! Here's what you do: 1. choose your fav Batt Style in the drop down menu 2. Add to Cart & proceed to checkout I blend you a 55gr-60gr batt & ship to you within 7 days. easy! SOYA sMOOthie: Good enough to eat (hehe) delicious layers of handdyed merino + ecru soya - smoothly blended to felt & spin beautifully. GOATEE-MOJO Lush Kid Mohair and Merino carded gently to keep lock structure intact. LANDSCAPE Delicious gradient batts with hues depicting landscape scenes. See blue/green batt pictured for example. Sprinkled with painterly textures. A wooldancer Signature Style, our fave for singles yarns. Also beautiful to felt. MIX'D MEDIA : Textured ARt Batts! An assortment of fine wools + extra media = more Bang in your Batt! Media selection is random and may contain any of the following: : cassette tape : tulle : silk scarf strips / fabric : yarn snippets : sparkle : noils & nubbs DUO-TONE: 2 colour layers, natural coloured base + handdyed topping sandwiched together to produce the familiar candystripe / barber pole effect when spun. PINATA SURPRISE MYSTERY BATT + ADD-INs I'll whip you up an art batt full of texture, spectacle and surprise, and include some fun spingredients too! Super fun batt to spark your creativity!

name: Big Top kit // Handdyed wool top + extras // Apricot Jam
description:
Big Top kits were born from my joy of seeking, finding & mixing fibres when spinning. All the different elements add such fun to the process of spinning!

These are my fav kits for spinning variable thickness yarns. I then crochet freeform beanies with the resultant yarn, making truly one of a kind Artisan Beanies.. Spin a yarn, felt, create a unique textile project. Enjoy!

This pack contains 110gr of the following fibres:
- 54gr Falkland combed top in Apricot Cinnamon colourway
- 40gr merino/tussah silk/Seacell/Angelina batt
- 6gr handdyed Wenslydale locks from Namaste Farms USA
- x2 strips vintage silk strips 55cm x 2cm

name: Silk Hankies // Shibori dyed // Choose your colour
description:
Mulberry Silk Hankies handdyed in many beautiful colours using a shibori clamping technique, rendering repeat patterning on the silk. Beautiful 2-tone layering of colours will create a lovely movement in your piece.

Simply peel off the layers, pierce the centre, draft and knit or spin!

May also be felted. Why not make a cobweb scarf.. Colourful and fun for your next craft project.

name: SPINSTAR // Rock Star batts // Coldplay-inspired
description:
I'm thrilled to offer Spinstar items on her behalf. My darling 11year-old daughter is a talented budding fibre artist. She designed two new product lines for the recent Australian Wool Show, with great success! 

All proceeds of SPINSTAR product sales go directly to Arliah. I am proud to be sponsoring her with her fibre arts, and I hope you will be too! 

ARLIAH TALKS ABOUT HER ROCK STAR BATTS:
I enjoy listening to music and had an idea to make batts inspired by the cd covers of some of my fav musicians. 

There are 3 artists I have covered:
Claire Bowditch, The Moon Looked On (pinks white, black)
Gotye, Making Mirrors (gradients white/colour)
Coldplay, Myloxoloto (bright multi-colour)
Mum helped me work out how to put the colours together and then I did it my way! Fibre is from mum's handdyed merino and i added some sparkles.

I will spin this batt for you. Purchase the batt. Then purchase the Spinstar Handspun // MX, custom spinning option (see separate listing)

Thanks for looking at my batts, Arliah Spinstar *-*

Listing is for one batt, priced separately.

name: English Leicester // Soft Curly locks // top shelf 100gr/3.5oz
description:
- Curly Lambs (18-22cm staple)
This fine fleece has been hand-reared by a local shepeherdess who adores her flock.

Tailspin, handspin or Felt these long locks into a falling trellis, flowing, wild & free!

100gr hand selected unwashed raw fleece. 

OVERSEAS SHIPPING?
Please Select WASHED if item is to be shipped overseas.

name: Polworth locks // long, soft, lustrous // natural or handdyed
description:
Australian grown Polworth wool locks with a long and fine staple (lincoln & merino heritage) from a small local wool farm in NSW. 
Polworth, a Super-soft and beautiful fleece, will add wonderful texture to your handspun yarn & felt projects!

Naturale : 100grams undyed white raw fleece
Custom handdyed : 60gr coloured / washed fleece

name: Finn fleece // CURLY locks // top shelf 100gr
description:
Finnish Landrace sheep from a local small farmhold are fed on a diet high in seaweed, providing nutrient-rich wool fleece that is unique. With a soft lanolin unlike the waxy merino, this heritage breed is a go-to for lovers of the finest wool fibres! Perfect for felting and spinning

*photo of dyed locks is an example of how beautifully Finn dyes!

Available in stock:
- Coated: This flock wear jumpers to keep VM away - lush & clean

name: Workshop // Art Yarn sessions // Katoomba NSW AU
description: Do you love the flair & texture of handspun art-yarn? This series of advanced workshops reveals a variety of creative techniques used to make highly individual & expressive yarn by hand on your spinning wheel. The Spin Sessions are an intensive study of each of the techniques taught at Michelle's 2day Art Yarn workshop, including some of her own original techniques. These sessions are designed for spinners new to art yarn spinning, as well as previous workshop attendees wishing to refine technique & gain individual tuition. A Private Session may be customized to your spinning needs! Session 1: The Art of Plying + Learn NEW Butterfly Cocoon technique! -Squiggle-ply (original Wooldancer technique) -Cocoon / Nubs : in singles AND plied yarn -NEW Witchetty Grub Ply (Wooldancer technique) -Crescent Moon / Halo We will make cocoons with a fun variety of fibres: bamboo, multi-layered batts, glitz and fabric! Session 2: Coils & Add-in's -Supercoils -Beehive/Seashell ply -Corkscrew elastic yarn -Add-ins : a How-To for singles & plied yarns to ensure your embellishments stay in place! Session 3: NEW Core FX + SPECIAL DISCOUNT ON CARDERS AT THIS WORKSHOP! Enhance your Basic corespinning skills -Jellyfish / Mohairy : a thin layer of mohair over a novelty core - make a boa using tailspinning & tassels - + plying effects on corespun yarns In addition to the above techniques we will fine tune the following essential skills: The art of starting your spin: ie. secure joins for different core threads; Choosing fibre preparations for a range of Art Yarn techniques; Finishing methods for Art Yarns. ____________________ If you wish to take a 2day Art Spin workshop, please purchase the 2day listing from the drop-down menu. ____________________ The sessions are held in Katoomba Blue Mountains Australia from 10am-3pm on the first Sunday of each month, ie. Pay in Sept for Oct date

name: Workshop // BATT LAB + Core-spinning // Private Session
description:
*Combined Batt Lab & Corespinning workshop: Learn how to spin drum-carded batt blends using 3 corespinning techniques!

Learn the art of carding batts, using a board carder to open up locks for corespinning & creating rolags for handspinning & felting. We will explore the following skills in a hands-on workshop:

Fibre preparation for a variety of ingredients
- blending fibre types for success
- smooth & textural styles
- striping & colour designs
- batts & Fibre Art ROLAGS!

Explore various methods of Core-spinning using a variety of core threads.

Date: } Contact me to request dates for a Private workshop, then once confirmed, use this listing to book online.
Time: 10am - 4pm 
*note: carding in the morning,  Art Yarn core-spinning in the afternoon

Details about what to bring for the day will be emailed to you upon payment. yay!

View pix of other workshops here:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/wooldancer/sets/72157609436152623/with/4595133654/

name: Workshop // Exreme Hand-spinning } 2013
description:
Take your spin skills to the next level ..

If you like to spin creative yarns, you will LOVE this workshop!
Geared to Art Yarn spinsters who are keen to enhance known art spinning skills, this workshop will ramp them up a notch!

We will cover techniques not previously taught in my Art Yarn workshops, and mix them up to create new ones!

Spin uber texture-filled yarns that express vibrancy and contrast, just like my Loop De Loop yarn & create instantly wearable unknit yarn!
We will also cover the following techniques:
+ Navajo the Navajo :  make an Unknit Loop
+ NEW Reverse Corespun Coils
+ NEW Mega twists in Singles 
+ Cranking Combo-soup yarns and more!

If you have been to my workshops, or have never spun with me before, you are in for the spin-time of your life!

If the weather is sunny & calm, we will spin outdoors!

Price includes billy tea and snacks. BYO Lunch
10am-4pm

Book your seat now.. Limited Places!

name: Inwood Smith // ESpinner "Jenny" with Art Yarn options
description:
The Jenny is a lovely hand-crafted Australian made electric spinning wheel. 
It comes with extra features to enable you to spin bulky art yarn as well as finer handspun yarn. 

Features:
Jenny Espinner comes with sliding hook flyer, 2 standard bobbins + Jumbo bobbin for plying,  On-board Lazy Kate, 240 to 12v power pack, on/off pause switch, variable speed control & spin/ply functions, Scotch tension operation.

Additional Extras:
- Jumbo Flyer/Bobbin/large o-ring novelty eye insert
- Standard Bobbins
- 12v Lead to plug into car lighter socket / portable battery pack 
- The on/off switch can be set up to be either a foot switch or a hand switch.

name: Inwood 6" / 10" Drum Carder + NEW Packer Brush option
description: Inwood Smith : artisan carding equipment specialists. For over 60years Inwood Smith have been manufacturing a range of high-quality carding tools for fibre artists using a unique fillet cloth. >> NEW PACKER BRUSH ACCESSORY for burnishing fibre! Choose Packer Brush option to have yours fitted, or order a Packer Brush Kit separately for older DC models in additional listing. The 6" Drum Carder is Perfect for creating your own unique fibre blends : choose from medium 90ppi or standard/coarse 50ppi cloth. The 10" option is extra-wide & prepares up to 150gr batts. WHICH CLOTH SHOULD I CHOOSE? Wish to make textured art-fibre batts? : The Standard fitted cloth: 50ppi is perfect for art yarn & textural batts! :Medium 90ppi cloth is ideal for fine fibres such as Alpaca, Camel, Angora, Silks and fine wools 19micron & below. All carders come fitted with: : Stainless steel infeed tray : Heavy duty 4 pulley drive : Simple drum & belt adjustment : Removable handle for easier transport : Tools included: clamp, doffing brush & long screwdriver for doffing and machine adjustment : Sturdy construction in Australian hardwood with clear lacquer finish. ***PLUS: RECEIVE BONUS 100GR FIBRE FREE with every drum carder purchase*** Get a Curly-Mixed bag with Course Cloth carders + a SMOOTHie Mixed bag with Medium carders. Fibre & Carder are shipped separately. Manufactured in Australia by Inwood-Smith Ships immediately. Contact me for International Shipping quote. *NOTE: any excess shipping paid will be refunded promptly.

name: Inwood Smith // *NEW* PACKER BRUSH for IS Drum Carder
description:
The latest product from Inwood Smith, the Packer Brush makes burnishing a breeze!

Order the Packer Brush BRACKET KIT for older DC models:
- includes 2 mounting brackets and brush

Order the Packer Brush SET for DC's after 11/2011:
- includes Brush, Knob and Screw 

Optional Hand Brush Accessory

*New drum carders can be fitted with the Packer Brush, and are now available in separate listing

name: Inwood Smith // Drum Carder Belt
description:
If you have a very old Inwood Smith carder that requires a replacement belt, this is your lucky day! Purchase one here and you'll soon be on your way to carding up your favourite batts again!

The real-McCoy belt.

name: Inwood Smith // Hand Carders // Medium or Fine cloth
description:
Hand Carders are a perfect first carding tool.  Create woollen-style rolags (mini batts) perfect spinning light, airy and warm yarns.

Ergonomic smooth round handle with curve-shaped cloth. Very easy to use, unique fillet cloth.

Available in the folowing card cloth types: 
- Medium (90ppi) 
- Fine cloth (170ppi specifically for Alpaca & Angora)

name: Inwood Smith // Flicker brush // medium cloth 90ppi
description:
The perfect tool for flicking the dirty or greasy tips of wool locks, & to separate fibres for handspinning. 

Australian Made. 1 each.

name: Inwood Smith // Board Carder // for rolags & clouds
description: Quickly & efficiently cards light & airy locks, perfect for corespinning mohair! - 30cm x 20cm / 12inch x 8inch cloth size - Available in medium (90tpi) or fine (170tpi) card cloth, simply choose from the drop down menu below - Supplied with clamp and one hand carder A unique vertical carder. With the aid of the clamp provided, the Board Carder is fixed to the edge of the table. With the handcard provided, the action is to sweep the handcard from above. These carders are very quick method of carding blends, and are a step up from using Hand Carders. Fibre clouds and Rolags may be produced on a Board Carder. Note on making Novelty blends: Add noils & fine threads with fleece locks for lively textural blends.

name: Dye Workshop // Sept & OCT 2013 Katoomba NSW AU
description: :: Eco-friendly Wool dyeing workshops :: Learn the art of dyeing with Greener Shades, a beautiful & NEW environmentally friendly dye suite for wool & protein fibres. Rainbow Fibre : Session 1 Learn how to dye wool fibre for felting or spinning. Using eco-friendly Greener Shades Dyes we will learn low water immersion microwave & kettle dye methods to dye unspun clean wool & protein fibres. Learn how to achieve an exhausted dye bath and random + repeat colourways Rainbow YARN - Session 2 Learn how to dye yarn with the spectrum of Greener Shades dyes. We will learn how to paint skeins in pleasing colourways using steam dye methods session 1 FIBRE: 9:30am - 1:00pm session 2 YARN: 1:30pm - 5:00pm Details of materials required sent upon registration Now Booking 22 Sept & 20 Oct 2013, limited places available. Materials List will be sent upon confirmation of payment received. Workshops and Yarn Clubs are not eligible for coupon discounts.

name: AQUARELLE liquid Natural dyes // NEW IN STOCK
description:
We are loving the versatility of these pure natural pigment dyes by Botanical Colours.

Aquarelle are a new product range of natural dye pigments produced in liquid (not powder) and can be used like acid dyes!

Acid and Vege Auxiliaries may be used to aid in colour shifts and enhance colours produced. We highly recommend the 'Aquarelle Instructional' booklet to get you started!

-Excerpt from Botanical Colours:
Aquarelle colors mix easily and are beautiful and lightfast. One of the most exciting colors is a liquid indigo that does not require a vat and produces a striking turquoise shade on protein fibers. 

This liquid indigo is an improved formulation of Saxon Blue, which was first created in the 18th century. This means you can add the blue directly into your dyebath along with a bit of yellow and get a beautiful green. Aqua, turquoise and marine blue are now at your fingertips. If you have always wanted to use indigo but didnt want to deal with a vat, this is an easy way to add a unique blue to your color palette. 

These special dyes work with a group of non-metallic auxiliaries. The auxiliaries are non-toxic liquids and both the dyes and the auxiliaries have been certified by Control Union as compliant with the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS).  

Please note that the Aquarelle Liquid Indigo works best on wool, silk alpaca and other animal fibers.  On cotton, bamboo, Tencel, linen and hemp it is a very pale blue.  However, the rest of the Aquarelle dyes work equally well on any natural fiber.

name: Dye // Greener Shades // Starter Kit 9 colours + citric acid
description: Now available in Australia direct from US. Wooldancer is a Proud Australian stockist. Greener Shades (tm) is a non-hazardous, non-chrome dye for use on silk, wool, nylon, or any animal fibre. Formulated without the use of hazardous metals, Greener Shades provides the washfastness and lightfastness of traditional acid dye without relying on metal compounds to achieve bright and beautiful colors. Dye colours mix together as a suite to create an unlimited colour palette. Perfect for colour-mixing and experiments in the home studio! Starter kit consists of: 9 colours in 7gr bags, plus 225gr/4oz citric acid [each colour will dye 700grams protein fibre to full Depth Of Shade] Individual colour pots are available in larger quanities: see additional Greener Shades Dye listing. Note: This product is now shipped Direct in bags not pots - it's the most cost effective means we have found to bring these dyes into Australia, which means You pay less for shipping!

name: Dye // Greener Shades // Organic heavy-metal free Acid dye
description: Now available in Australia direct from US. Proud Australian stockist. Greener Shades (tm) is a non-hazardous, non-chrome dye for use on silk, wool, nylon, or any animal fibre. Formulated without the use of hazardous metals, Greener Shades provides the washfastness and lightfastness of traditional acid dye without relying on metal compounds to achieve bright and beautiful colors. Listing is for 1 jar : will dye 1.35 kilos protein fibre to full Depth Of Shade. Available in 9 colours: Primary: Ruby Red, Flame Red, Sunshine Yellow, River Blue. Secondary: Sunset Orange, Amazon Green, Coral Reef Aqua, Amethyst Purple & Midnight Black.

name: Dye e-book // Greener Shades : Instructional colour mixing Guide
description:
The Original ebook + Revised ebook NOW AVAILABLE:

The Original 'World of Colour' 28page ebook dispatched instantly,
 + a newly revised 36 page ebook NOW AVAILABLE - PDF sent to your inbox within 24hours of receipt of order. Details below:

The Original detailed manual providing dye formulas and ratios for accurate colour mixing.  Colour swatches are pictured along with dye percentages. Also included are detailed instructions for dyeing with Greener Shades Dyes and tips to make your dye experience as successful and enjoyable as possible!
A fabulous resource if you wish to achieve repeatable results.
- 28page PDF will be electronically dispatched to you instantly upon payment.

>> Newly Revised Greener Shades World of Color Dye eBook contains:
Additional dye formulas for over 100 different colors, all using the eight colors of Greener Shades Dye, plus black.  This 36-page Dye Book has been recently updated with new Jewel Tones, Pastels, Highlights, and Earth Color formulas.
